original: @174b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @174b rgya gar skad du /

original: a'arya dzam gu li n'a ma bi dy'a /
analyzed: a'arya dzam gu li n'a ma bi dy'a /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /

original: 'phags ba dug sel ba zhes bya ba'i rig sngags /
analyzed: 'phags ba dug sel ba zhes bya ba'i rig sngags /

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mngon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mngon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /

original: sngon byung ba byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na /🔽gangs kyi ri yi byang ngos na //
analyzed: sngon byung ba byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na / gangs kyi ri yi byang ngos na //
translated: In the past, when I was a Bodhisattva,

original: sbos dang ldan ba'i ri bo la //
analyzed: sbos dang ldan ba'i ri bo la //
translated: On the northern side of the snow mountain,🔽On the mountain of the one possessing a treasure,

original: ri rgyal de yi sul gnas tshe //
analyzed: ri rgyal de yi sul gnas tshe //
translated: Dwelling in the crevice of that king of mountains,

original: gzhon nu bsod nams brgya yi mtshan //
analyzed: gzhon nu bsod nams brgya yi mtshan //
translated: The youth with the marks of a hundred merits,

original: ae na ya yi pags gyon la /🔽sbrul gyis brgyan pa'i ska rags can //
analyzed: ae na ya yi pags gyon la / sbrul gyis brgyan pa'i ska rags can //
translated: Wearing the skin of an enaya,🔽With a belt adorned with snakes,

original: gdug pa'i sbrul gyis mgo rgyan byas //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sbrul gyis mgo rgyan byas //
translated: With the head ornament of a poisonous snake,

original: mthong na gdug pa'i rna rgyan can //
analyzed: mthong na gdug pa'i rna rgyan can //
translated: When seen, she wears earrings of snakes.

original: dug gi me tog rnams za zhing //
analyzed: dug gi me tog rnams za zhing //

original: ma lu ta yi lcug khu 'thung //
analyzed: ma lu ta yi lcug khu 'thung //
translated: And drinks the sap of the maluva vine.

original: nga la de 'bod 'bod du 'jug /
analyzed: nga la de 'bod 'bod du 'jug /
translated: She makes me call out to her.

original: bu khyod tshur shog ba la nyon //🔽nga la dug sel ces bya ba //
analyzed: bu khyod tshur shog ba la nyon // nga la dug sel ces bya ba //
translated: Son, come here and listen to me.

original: dug 'jig rig sngags dam pa yod //
analyzed: dug 'jig rig sngags dam pa yod //
translated: I have a mantra called “Poison Destroyer,”🔽A sublime mantra that destroys poison.

original: dug rnams gang yin de kun ni //
analyzed: dug rnams gang yin de kun ni //

original: nga yi ming gis 'jig par 'gyur //🔽tadya th'a / aom ai li mitte /
analyzed: nga yi ming gis 'jig par 'gyur // tadya th'a / aom ai li mitte /
translated: They will all be destroyed by my name.🔽Tadyathā: Oṃ ilimitte🔽tilimitte

original: @175a *// ti li mitte /🔽ai li ti li mitte /
analyzed: @175a *// ti li mitte / ai li ti li mitte /

analyzed: dumbe / du m'a l'i ye /

analyzed: du se / du sa la ye /

analyzed: takke / ta ka karne /

analyzed: marme / marme ra ne /

analyzed: kashma re / kashma ra mu ka te / aa gha ne /

analyzed: aa gha na gha ne; ai li aa li ye /

analyzed: aa kh'a / a'i ae /

original: aa by'a ai ae /
analyzed: aa by'a ai ae /

analyzed: shve te / sha ta /

analyzed: tunte / aa nu rakte sv'ah'a /

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /

original: nga'i dug sel gyi rig sngags 'di ni /
analyzed: nga'i dug sel gyi rig sngags 'di ni /

original: sbyin pa thams cad dkar po ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad dkar po ste /

original: sus rig sngags 'di lan gcig thos pa de la lo bdun gyi bar du sbrul gyis mi za'o //
analyzed: sus rig sngags 'di lan gcig thos pa de la lo bdun gyi bar du sbrul gyis mi za'o //
translated: Whoever hears this awareness mantra just once will not be bitten by a snake for seven years.

original: de'i lus la dug gis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: de'i lus la dug gis mi tshugs so //
translated: Poison will not affect their body.

original: sbrul gang zhig de la 'dzin pa de'i mgo shing aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas so //
analyzed: sbrul gang zhig de la 'dzin pa de'i mgo shing aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas so //
translated: If a snake were to bite them, its head would split into seven pieces like the segments of an arjaka plant.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshig 'di sprul gyi mdun du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshig 'di sprul gyi mdun du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not recite this awareness mantra in front of a snake.

analyzed: de ltar na / dug sel gyi @175b 'byung po 'dus pa thams cad la rig sngags gang brjod cing bsnyad pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: thus🔽all the assembled poison-removing spirits, whatever mantras are recited and spoken to them,

original: dug 'di mi 'dug par gyur cig /🔽sbyin bar byed pa'i gan du song zhig /
analyzed: dug 'di mi 'dug par gyur cig / sbyin bar byed pa'i gan du song zhig /
translated: Let this poison be destroyed.🔽Go to the one who gives.

original: 'dzin pa'i gan du song zhig /🔽me'i nang du song zhig /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i gan du song zhig / me'i nang du song zhig /
translated: Go to the one who holds.🔽Go into the fire.

original: chu'i nang du song zhig /🔽thang la song zhig /🔽ka ba'i nang du song zhig /
analyzed: chu'i nang du song zhig / thang la song zhig / ka ba'i nang du song zhig /
translated: Go into the water.🔽Go to the plain.🔽Go into the pillar.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas dge slong de dag yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, the monks were delighted and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: 'phags pa dug sel ces bya ba'i rig sngag rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa dug sel ces bya ba'i rig sngag rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble knowledge-mantra called “Removing Poisons” is complete.
